types.name: AffineMatrix
types.docstring:
AffineMatrix represents a 2D affine transform that preserves parallel lines.
 See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Affine_transformation
types.signature:
pub(all) struct AffineMatrix {
  a : Double
  b : Double
  c : Double
  d : Double
  tx : Double
  ty : Double
}

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone returns a copy of this 2D affine matrix.

methods.name: copy
methods.docstring: copy copies another 2D affine matrix into itself and returns itself.

methods.name: determinant
methods.docstring: determinant returns the determinant of the 2D affine matrix.

methods.name: from_center_scale
methods.docstring:
AffineMatrix::from_center_scale returns a new 2D affine matrix that scales
 from the provided center point.

methods.name: from_rotation
methods.docstring:
AffineMatrix::from_rotation returns a new 2D affine matrix from a rotation `angle`
 in degrees.

methods.name: from_scale
methods.docstring: AffineMatrix::from_scale returns a new 2D affine matrix from scale `v`.

methods.name: from_scale_scalar
methods.docstring: AffineMatrix::from_scale_scalar returns a new 2D affine matrix from uniform scale `s`.

methods.name: from_transform
methods.docstring: AffineMatrix::from_transform returns a new 2D affine matrix from a Transform.

methods.name: from_translation
methods.docstring: AffineMatrix::from_translation returns a new 2D affine matrix from translation `v`.

methods.name: from_translation_points
methods.docstring:
AffineMatrix::from_translation_points returns a new 2D affine matrix that
 translates from p1 to p2.

methods.name: invert
methods.docstring: invert inverts this 2D affine matrix.

methods.name: is_identity
methods.docstring: is_identity returns true if this 2D affine matrix is the identity matrix.

methods.name: is_inf
methods.docstring: is_inf returns true if any elements of this 2D affine matrix are infinite.

methods.name: is_invertible
methods.docstring: is_invertible returns true if this 2D affine matrix is invertible.

methods.name: is_mirror
methods.docstring: is_mirror returns true if this 2D affine matrix mirrors either axis.

methods.name: is_nan
methods.docstring: is_nan returns true if any elements of this 2D affine matrix are NaN (not a number).

methods.name: is_orthogonal
methods.docstring:
is_orthogonal returns true if the two basis vectors of the 2D affine matrix
 are orthogonal within the provided tolerance.

methods.name: is_uniform_scale
methods.docstring:
is_uniform_scale returns true if both basis vectors of this 2D affine matrix
 are of the same length.

methods.name: mul
methods.docstring: mul multiplies this 2D affine matrix with another.

methods.name: mul_without_translation
methods.docstring:
mul_without_translation multiplies this 2D affine matrix with another,
 discarding the transation.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: AffineMatrix::new returns a new 2D affine matrix.
methods.signature: fn AffineMatrix::new(a~ : Double = .., b~ : Double = .., c~ : Double = .., d~ : Double = .., tx~ : Double = .., ty~ : Double = ..) -> AffineMatrix

methods.name: normalize
methods.docstring:
normalize scales the basis vectors of this 2D affine matrix
 so that they have unit length.

methods.name: op_mul
methods.docstring: op_mul multiplies two 2D affine matrices together, returning a new one.

methods.name: origin
methods.docstring:
origin translates the matrix such that the center of future
 scale, rotate, and skew transformations will be `v`.

methods.name: pre_mul
methods.docstring:
pre_mul multiplies another matrix `m` by this 2D affine matrix, then
 stores and returns the result.

methods.name: pre_mul_without_translation
methods.docstring:
pre_mul_without_translation multiplies another matrix `m` by this 2D affine matrix,
 discarding the translate, then stores and returns the result.

methods.name: rotate
methods.docstring: rotate rotates this 2D affine matrix by `angle` degrees.

methods.name: scale
methods.docstring: scale scales this 2D affine matrix by `v`.

methods.name: scale_scalar
methods.docstring: scale_scalar scales this 2D affine matrix uniformly by `s`.

methods.name: skew
methods.docstring: skew skews the Y basis vector of this 2D affine matrix by `angle` degrees.

methods.name: to_transform
methods.docstring: to_transform converts this 2D affine matrix to a Transform.

methods.name: translate
methods.docstring: translate translates this 2D affine matrix by position `v`.

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: Anchor
types.docstring:
Anchor represents a single point in a path. Two anchors form a segment.
 The position of an Anchor is absolute and the handles are both relative.

methods.name: affine_transform
methods.docstring: affine_transform transforms this Anchor by the provided `affine_matrix`.

methods.name: affine_transform_without_translation
methods.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this Anchor's rotation, scale,
 and skew, without affecting its translation.

methods.name: all_anchors
methods.docstring: all_anchors returns all anchors.

methods.name: bounding_box
methods.docstring: bounding_box returns a BoundingBox for this Anchor.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone makes a new copy of this Anchor.

methods.name: closest_point
methods.docstring:
closest_point returns the closest point to `point` or None if no point is found.
 area_of_interest is used to focus the computation within a smaller region.

methods.name: has_tangent_handles
methods.docstring:
has_tangent_handles returns true if this Anchor has handles that
 are tangent to each other.

methods.name: has_zero_handles
methods.docstring: has_zero_handles returns true if this Anchor has handles that are both zero.

methods.name: is_contained_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring: is_contained_by_bounding_box returns true if this Anchor lies within `box`.

methods.name: is_intersected_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_intersected_by_bounding_box returns true if the Anchor lies on the
 boundary of `box`.

methods.name: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box returns true if the Anchor is within `box`.

methods.name: loose_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
loose_bounding_box is a simple computation that returns a BoundingBox which
 may not be the smallest possible.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring:
Anchor::new returns a new anchor. You must either create new Vec2 points
 or clone them before passing them in.
methods.signature: fn Anchor::new(position~ : Vec2 = .., handle_in~ : Vec2 = .., handle_out~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Anchor

methods.name: reverse
methods.docstring: reverse reverses this Anchor.

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
methods.signature: fn Anchor::transform(self : Anchor, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Anchor

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: to_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: from_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: BoundingBox
types.docstring: BoundingBox represents a minimum bounding box as an axis-aligned rectangle.

methods.name: area
methods.docstring:
area represents the signed area of the bounding box (width*height).
 If min > max, the area will be negative.

methods.name: boolean_intersect
methods.docstring:
boolean_intersect returns a new BoundingBox representing the intersection
 of this bounding box with one or more boxes if one exists.

methods.name: canonicalize
methods.docstring: canonicalize ensures that min < max.

methods.name: center
methods.docstring: center returns the center point of the bounding box (the average of min and max).

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone makes a copy of the bounding box.

methods.name: contains_bounding_box
methods.docstring: contains_bounding_box returns true if `box` is contained within this bounding box.

methods.name: contains_point
methods.docstring: contains_point returns true if `point` is contained within this bounding box.

methods.name: expand_scalar
methods.docstring: expand_scalar expands this bounding box by a scalar distance on all sides.

methods.name: expand_to_include_bounding_box
methods.docstring: expand_to_include_bounding_box expands this bounding box to also cover `box`.

methods.name: expand_to_include_point
methods.docstring: expand_to_include_point expands this bounding box to include `point`.

methods.name: from_points
methods.docstring: BoundingBox::from_points constructs the minimum bounding box containing `points`.

methods.name: height
methods.docstring: height returns the height of the bounding box.

methods.name: is_inf
methods.docstring: is_inf returns true if either min or max is_inf.

methods.name: is_nan
methods.docstring: is_nan returns true if either min or max is_nan.

methods.name: max_reversed
methods.docstring:
BoundingBox::max_reversed returns a new BoundingBox with min=+infinity
 and max=-infinity.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: BoundingBox::new returns a new empty BoundingBox.

methods.name: overlaps_bounding_box
methods.docstring: overlaps_bounding_box returns true if any part of `box` overlaps this bounding box.

methods.name: size
methods.docstring: size returns a vector representing the (width,height) of the bounding box.

methods.name: width
methods.docstring: width returns the width of the bounding box.

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: Color
types.docstring: Color represents a color in RGBA color space.

methods.name: as_fill
methods.docstring: as_fill is a convenience function for setting a fill color.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone returns a new copy of this Color.

methods.name: from_css_string
methods.docstring: Color::from_css_string returns a color from a CSS string.

methods.name: from_hsva
methods.docstring: Color::from_hsva creates a color by converting HSVA space to RGBA.
methods.signature: fn Color::from_hsva(hue : Double, saturation : Double, value : Double, alpha : Double) -> Color

methods.name: from_rgb8_number
methods.docstring: Color::from_rgb8_number returns a color from a bit-packed RGB8 format.

methods.name: luminance
methods.docstring: luminance returns the relative luminance of this color for standard human vision.

methods.name: mix
methods.docstring: mix linearly interpolates between this Color and `c` with mixing factor `t`.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: Color::new returns a new color.
methods.signature: fn Color::new(r~ : Double = .., g~ : Double = .., b~ : Double = .., a~ : Double = ..) -> Color

methods.name: set
methods.docstring: set sets the RGBA components of this Color.
methods.signature: fn Color::set(self : Color, r : Double, g : Double, b : Double, a : Double) -> Color

methods.name: to_css_hex_string
methods.docstring: to_css_hex_string returns a CSS-style hex string for this color.

methods.name: to_css_rgba_string
methods.docstring: to_css_rgba_string returns a CSS-style "rgba()" string for this color.

methods.name: to_css_string
methods.docstring: to_css_string returns a CSS-style string for this color.

methods.name: to_hsva
methods.docstring:
to_hsva converts this color to the HSVA color space, returning
 [hue, saturation, value, alpha] in the range (0..1).

methods.name: to_rgb8_number
methods.docstring: to_rgb8_number returns a bit-packed number in RGB8 format.

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: to_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: from_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: CompoundPath
types.docstring: CompoundPath represents one or more paths that typically make up a font glyph.

methods.name: affine_transform
methods.docstring: affine_transform transforms this CompoundPath by `affine_matrix`.

methods.name: affine_transform_without_translation
methods.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this CompoundPath by `affine_matrix`
 without affecting translation.

methods.name: all_anchors
methods.docstring: all_anchors returns a flattened array of all anchors in this CompoundPath.

methods.name: as_graphic
methods.docstring: as_graphic returns a CompoundPath as a Graphic.

methods.name: assign_fill
methods.docstring: assign_fill assigns a fill to this CompoundPath.

methods.name: assign_stroke
methods.docstring: assign_stroke assigns a stroke to this CompoundPath.

methods.name: assign_style
methods.docstring: assign_style assigns a stroke and fill style to this CompoundPath.

methods.name: bounding_box
methods.docstring:
bounding_box returns the smallest axis-aligned bounding box that contains
 this CompoundPath or None.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone makes a new copy of this CompoundPath.

methods.name: closest_point
methods.docstring: closest_point returns the closest point to `point` that lies on this CompoundPath or None.

methods.name: contains_point
methods.docstring: contains_point returns true if this CompoundPath contains `point`.

methods.name: copy_style
methods.docstring: copy_style copies the fill and stroke from `graphic`.

methods.name: first_styled
methods.docstring: first_styled returns this CompoundPath if it is styled or None.

methods.name: has_style
methods.docstring: has_style returns true if this CompoundPath has fill or stroke.

methods.name: is_contained_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_contained_by_bounding_box returns true if no part of this CompoundPath
 lies beyond its min or max.

methods.name: is_intersected_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_intersected_by_bounding_box returns true if part of this CompoundPath crosses
 the boundary between inside and outside of `box`.

methods.name: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_overlapped_by_bounding_box returns if true if a point can be chosen
 that is inside both the CompoundPath and `box`.

methods.name: loose_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
loose_bounding_box returns an approximate bounding box for this CompoundPath.
 It may not be the smallest possible bounding box, but is cheaper to compute.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: CompoundPath::new creates a new CompoundPath.

methods.name: op_get
methods.docstring: op_get is a convenience function.

methods.name: op_set
methods.docstring: op_set is a convenience function.
methods.signature: fn CompoundPath::op_set(self : CompoundPath, index : Int, path : Path) -> Unit

methods.name: primitives
methods.docstring: primitives returns a flattened array of Graphics primitives.

methods.name: remove_fill
methods.docstring: remove_fill removes fill styling from this CompoundPath.

methods.name: remove_stroke
methods.docstring: remove_stroke removes stroke styling from this CompoundPath.

methods.name: reverse
methods.docstring: reverse reverses this CompoundPath.

methods.name: rotate
methods.docstring: rotate rotates a CompoundPath clockwise by `angle` in degrees.

methods.name: scale
methods.docstring: scale scales a CompoundPath by `v`.

methods.name: scale_stroke
methods.docstring: scale_stroke scales the width of this stroke by `scale_factor`.

methods.name: style_contains_point
methods.docstring: style_contains_point returns true if this path's style contains `point`.

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
methods.signature: fn CompoundPath::transform(self : CompoundPath, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> CompoundPath

methods.name: translate
methods.docstring: translate translates a CompoundPath by `v`.

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: to_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: from_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: DrawError
types.docstring: DrawError represents an error that occured during graphic generation.

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: Fill::new returns a new fill style.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone returns a new copy of this Fill.

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: to_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: from_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: Graphic
types.docstring: Graphic represents a drawable graphic element.

methods.name: affine_transform
methods.docstring: affine_transform transforms this graphic by `affine_matrix`.

methods.name: affine_transform_without_translation
methods.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this graphic by `affine_matrix`
 without affecting the translation.

methods.name: all_anchors
methods.docstring: all_anchors returns all Anchors in this Graphic.

methods.name: all_compound_paths
methods.docstring: all_compound_paths returns all CompoundPaths in this Graphic.

methods.name: all_paths
methods.docstring: all_paths returns all Paths in this Graphic.

methods.name: all_paths_and_compound_paths
methods.docstring: all_paths_and_compound_paths returns all Paths and CompoundPaths in this Graphic.

methods.name: assign_fill
methods.docstring: assign_fill assigns a fill to this Graphic.

methods.name: assign_stroke
methods.docstring: assign_stroke assigns a stroke to this Graphic.

methods.name: assign_style
methods.docstring: assign_style assigns a fill and stroke style to this Graphic.

methods.name: bounding_box
methods.docstring: bounding_box returns the bounding box for this Graphic.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone returns a new copy of Graphic.

methods.name: closest_point
methods.docstring:
closest_point returns the closest Anchor to `point` that lies on this Graphic
 or None.

methods.name: contains_point
methods.docstring:
Graphic::contains_point returns a function that returns true if this
 Graphic contains `point`.

methods.name: copy_style
methods.docstring: copy_style copies the fill and stroke style from `graphic`.

methods.name: every
methods.docstring: Graphic::every returns true if all tests of `func` are true.

methods.name: first_fill
methods.docstring: first_fill returns the first fill from this Graphic.

methods.name: first_stroke
methods.docstring: first_stroke returns the first stroke from this Graphic.

methods.name: first_styled
methods.docstring:
first_styled returns the first Path or CompoundPath in this Graphic
 that has either a fill or a stroke, or None.

methods.name: fit_to
methods.docstring: fit_to scales and translates a Graphic to fix in `box`.

methods.name: has_style
methods.docstring: has_style returns true if this Graphic has either a stroke or a fill.

methods.name: is_contained_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
Graphic::is_contained_by_bounding_box returns a function that tests
 if a graphic is contained by the box.

methods.name: is_intersected_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
Graphic::is_intersected_by_bounding_box returns a function that tests
 if a graphic is intersected by the box.

methods.name: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
Graphic::is_overlapped_by_bounding_box returns a function that tests
 if a graphic is overlapped by the box.

methods.name: loose_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
loose_bounding_box returns an approximate bounding box for all items.
 It may not be the smallest possible bounding box, but is cheaper to compute.

methods.name: primitives
methods.docstring: primitives returns an array of primitives.

methods.name: remove_fill
methods.docstring: remove_fill a fill style from this Graphic.

methods.name: remove_stroke
methods.docstring: remove_stroke a stroke style from this Graphic.

methods.name: reverse
methods.docstring: reverse reverses this Graphic.

methods.name: rotate
methods.docstring: rotate rotates a Graphic clockwise by `angle` in degrees.

methods.name: scale
methods.docstring: scale scales a Graphic by `v`.

methods.name: scale_stroke
methods.docstring: scale_stroke scales the stroke width of this Graphic by `scale_factor`.

methods.name: some
methods.docstring: Graphic::some returns true if any calls to `func` are true.

methods.name: style_contains_point
methods.docstring:
Graphic::style_contains_point returns a function that returns true if this
 Graphic's style contains `point`.

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
methods.signature: fn Graphic::transform(self : Graphic, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Graphic

methods.name: translate
methods.docstring: translate translates a Graphic by `v`.

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: Group
types.docstring: Group represents a collection of Graphics elements.

methods.name: affine_transform
methods.docstring: affine_transform transforms this Group by `affine_matrix`.

methods.name: affine_transform_without_translation
methods.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this Group by `affine_matrix`
 without affecting the translation.

methods.name: all_anchors
methods.docstring: all_anchors returns all Anchors in this Group.

methods.name: all_compound_paths
methods.docstring: all_compound_paths returns all compound paths in this Group.

methods.name: all_paths
methods.docstring: all_paths returns all Paths in this Group.

methods.name: all_paths_and_compound_paths
methods.docstring: all_paths_and_compound_paths returns all Paths and CompoundPaths in this Group.

methods.name: as_graphic
methods.docstring: as_graphic returns a Group as a Graphic.

methods.name: assign_fill
methods.docstring: assign_fill assigns a fill to this Group.

methods.name: assign_stroke
methods.docstring: assign_stroke assigns a stroke to this Group.

methods.name: assign_style
methods.docstring: assign_style assigns a fill and stroke style to this Group.

methods.name: bounding_box
methods.docstring: bounding_box returns the bounding box for all items in the Group.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone returns a new copy of this Group.

methods.name: closest_point
methods.docstring:
closest_point returns the closest Anchor to `point` that lies on this Group
 or None.

methods.name: contains_point
methods.docstring: contains_point returns true if this Group contains `point`.

methods.name: copy_style
methods.docstring: copy_style copies the fill and stroke style from `graphic`.

methods.name: first_fill
methods.docstring: first_fill returns the first fill from this Group.

methods.name: first_stroke
methods.docstring: first_stroke returns the first stroke from this Group.

methods.name: first_styled
methods.docstring:
first_styled returns the first Path or CompoundPath in this Group
 that has either a fill or a stroke, or None.

methods.name: has_style
methods.docstring: has_style returns true if this Group has either a stroke or a fill.

methods.name: is_contained_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_contained_by_bounding_box returns true if no part of the Group
 lies beyond the box's min and max.

methods.name: is_intersected_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_intersected_by_bounding_box returns true if any part of the Group
 crosses the boundary between the inside and outside of `box`.

methods.name: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_overlapped_by_bounding_box returns true if a point can be found that
 is inside both the Graphic and the box.

methods.name: loose_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
loose_bounding_box returns an approximate bounding box for all items
 in the Group. It may not be the smallest possible bounding box, but
 is cheaper to compute.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: Group::new returns a new group.

methods.name: op_get
methods.docstring: op_get is a convenience function.

methods.name: op_set
methods.docstring: op_set is a convenience function.

methods.name: primitives
methods.docstring: primitives returns a flattened array of all Graphic primitives in this Group.

methods.name: remove_fill
methods.docstring: remove_fill removes a fill style from this Group.

methods.name: remove_stroke
methods.docstring: remove_stroke removes a stroke style from this Group.

methods.name: reverse
methods.docstring: reverse reverses this Group.

methods.name: rotate
methods.docstring: rotate rotates a Group clockwise by `angle` in degrees.

methods.name: scale
methods.docstring: scale scales a Group by `v`.

methods.name: scale_stroke
methods.docstring: scale_stroke scales the stroke width of this Group by `scale_factor`.

methods.name: style_contains_point
methods.docstring: style_contains_point returns true if this Group's style contains `point`.

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
methods.signature: fn Group::transform(self : Group, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Group

methods.name: translate
methods.docstring: translate translates a Group by `v`.

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: to_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: from_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: Path
types.docstring:
Path represents an open or closed path that can be stroked as an outline
 or filled. A 'clear' path is sub-path of a Path that defines
 regions of the filled path where no fill is added, for example in the
 center of the letter 'O'.
types.signature: pub(all) struct Path { anchors : Array[Anchor] closed : Bool clear : Bool fill : Fill? stroke : Stroke? }

methods.name: affine_transform
methods.docstring: affine_transform transforms this Path by `affine_matrix`.

methods.name: affine_transform_without_translation
methods.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this Path by `affine_matrix`
 without affecting translation.

methods.name: as_graphic
methods.docstring: as_graphic returns a Path as a Graphic.

methods.name: assign_fill
methods.docstring: assign_fill assigns a fill to this Path.

methods.name: assign_stroke
methods.docstring: assign_stroke assigns a stroke to this Path.

methods.name: assign_style
methods.docstring: assign_style assigns a stroke and fill style to this Path.
methods.signature: fn Path::assign_style(self : Path, fill : Fill?, stroke : Stroke?) -> Path

methods.name: bounding_box
methods.docstring:
bounding_box returns the smallest axis-aligned bounding box that contains
 this Path or None.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone makes a new copy of this Path.

methods.name: closest_point
methods.docstring: closest_point returns the closest point to `point` that lies on this Path or None.

methods.name: contains_point
methods.docstring: contains_point returns true if this Path contains `point`.

methods.name: copy_style
methods.docstring: copy_style copies the fill and stroke from `graphic`.

methods.name: first_styled
methods.docstring: first_styled returns this Path if it is styled or None.

methods.name: from_points
methods.docstring: Path::from_points connects a series of points with lines to form a Path.

methods.name: has_style
methods.docstring: has_style returns true if this Path has fill or stroke.

methods.name: is_contained_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_contained_by_bounding_box returns true if no part of this Path
 lies beyond its min or max.

methods.name: is_intersected_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_intersected_by_bounding_box returns true if part of this Path crosses
 the boundary between inside and outside of `box`.

methods.name: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
is_overlapped_by_bounding_box returns if true if a point can be chosen
 that is inside both the Path and `box`.

methods.name: loose_bounding_box
methods.docstring:
loose_bounding_box returns an approximate bounding box for this Path.
 It may not be the smallest possible bounding box, but is cheaper to compute.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: Path::new creates a new Path.
methods.signature: fn Path::new(anchors~ : Array[Anchor] = .., closed~ : Bool = .., clear~ : Bool = .., fill? : Fill, stroke? : Stroke) -> Path

methods.name: op_get
methods.docstring: op_get is a convenience function.

methods.name: op_set
methods.docstring: op_set is a convenience function.
methods.signature: fn Path::op_set(self : Path, index : Int, anchor : Anchor) -> Unit

methods.name: primitives
methods.docstring: primitives returns a flattened array of Graphics primitives.

methods.name: remove_fill
methods.docstring: remove_fill removes fill styling from this Path.

methods.name: remove_stroke
methods.docstring: remove_stroke removes stroke styling from this Path.

methods.name: reverse
methods.docstring: reverse reverses this Path.

methods.name: rotate
methods.docstring: rotate rotates a Path clockwise by `angle` in degrees.

methods.name: scale
methods.docstring: scale scales a Path by `v`.

methods.name: scale_stroke
methods.docstring: scale_stroke scales the width of this stroke by `scale_factor`.

methods.name: style_contains_point
methods.docstring: style_contains_point returns true if this path's style contains `point`.

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
methods.signature: fn Path::transform(self : Path, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Path

methods.name: translate
methods.docstring: translate translates a Path by `v`.

methods.docstring: automatically derived

types.name: Transform
types.signature: pub(all) struct Transform { position : Vec2 rotation : Double scale : Vec2 skew : Double origin : Vec2 }

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: Transform::new returns a new identity transform.
methods.signature: fn Transform::new(position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Transform

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output

types.name: Vec2

methods.name: add
methods.docstring: add adds the vector `v` to this vector.

methods.name: add_scalar
methods.docstring: add_scalar adds scalar `s` to this vector.

methods.name: affine_transform
methods.docstring:
affine_transform transforms this Vec2 by the `affine_matrix`.
 This is used when transforming a point or position.

methods.name: affine_transform_without_translation
methods.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this Vec2 by the `affine_matrix`
 but without performing translation.
 This is used when transforming a normal or tangent.

methods.name: almost_equals
methods.docstring: almost_equals returns true if the vectors are equal within the provided tolerance.
methods.signature: fn Vec2::almost_equals(self : Vec2, other : Vec2, tolerance~ : Double = ..) -> Bool

methods.name: angle
methods.docstring: angle returns the angle of this vector in degrees.

methods.name: angle_radians
methods.docstring: angle_radians returns the angle of this vector in radians.

methods.name: apply
methods.docstring: apply applies the provided `func` to both components of this vector.

methods.name: ceil
methods.docstring: ceil rounds the components of this vector to the next-higher integer.

methods.name: clone
methods.docstring: clone returns a new copy of this Vec2.

methods.name: copy
methods.docstring: copy copies `v` into this Vec2.

methods.name: cross
methods.docstring: cross returns the cross product between this vector and the vector `v`.

methods.name: distance
methods.docstring: distance returns the distance from this vector to `v`.

methods.name: distance_squared
methods.docstring: distance_squared returns the squared distance from this vector to `v`.

methods.name: div
methods.docstring: div divides this vector by vector `v`.

methods.name: div_scalar
methods.docstring: div_scalar divides this vector by scalar `s`.

methods.name: dot
methods.docstring: dot returns the dot product between this vector and the vector `v`.

methods.name: floor
methods.docstring: floor rounds the components of this vector to the next-lower integer.

methods.name: from_angle
methods.docstring: Vec2::from_angle returns a new unit vec2 from an angle in degrees.

methods.name: from_angle_radians
methods.docstring: Vec2::from_angle_radians returns a new unit vec2 from an angle in radians.

methods.name: infinity
methods.docstring: Vec::infinity returns a new Vec2 with infinite x and y.

methods.name: is_clockwise_from
methods.docstring:
is_clockwise_from returns true if this vector lies in the 180 region
 clockwise from `v`.

methods.name: is_inf
methods.docstring: is_inf returns true if either component is infinite.

methods.name: is_nan
methods.docstring: is_nan returns true if either component is NaN (not a number).

methods.name: is_valid
methods.docstring: is_valid returns whether or not this Vec2 is valid.

methods.name: is_zero
methods.docstring: is_zero returns true if both components of this vector are 0.

methods.name: length
methods.docstring: length returns the length of this vector.

methods.name: length_squared
methods.docstring: length_squared returns the squared length of this vector.

methods.name: max
methods.docstring:
max compares the components of this vector and `v` and sets this vector's
 components to the maximum of the two.

methods.name: min
methods.docstring:
min compares the components of this vector and `v` and sets this vector's
 components to the minimum of the two.

methods.name: mix
methods.docstring:
mix linearly interpolates this vector to the vector `v` by the mixing
 factor `t` (0..1).
methods.signature: fn Vec2::mix(self : Vec2, v : Vec2, t : Double) -> Vec2

methods.name: mul
methods.docstring: mul multiplies the vector `v` to this vector.

methods.name: mul_scalar
methods.docstring: mul_scalar multiplies scalar `s` to this vector.

methods.name: neg_infinity
methods.docstring: Vec::neg_infinity returns a new Vec2 with negative infinite x and y.

methods.name: negate
methods.docstring: negate multiplies both components (in-place) by -1.

methods.name: new
methods.docstring: Vec2::new returns a new Vec2.

methods.name: normalize
methods.docstring:
normalize scales this vector so that its length is 1.
 Note that this vector must already have a non-zero length.

methods.name: op_add
methods.docstring:
op_add adds vector `other` to this vector without modifying either one
 and returns the result.

methods.name: op_div
methods.docstring:
op_div divides this vector by vector `other` without modifying either one
 and returns the result.

methods.name: op_mul
methods.docstring:
op_mul multiplies vector `other` to this vector without modifying either one
 and returns the result.

methods.name: op_neg
methods.docstring: op_neg returns a negated copy of Vec2.

methods.name: op_sub
methods.docstring:
op_sub subtracts vector `other` from this vector without modifying either one
 and returns the result.

methods.name: project_onto
methods.docstring: project_onto projects this vector onto a non-zero vector `v`.

methods.name: rotate
methods.docstring: rotate rotates this vector clockwise by `angle` in degrees.

methods.name: rotate90
methods.docstring: rotate90 rotates this vector clockwise by 90.

methods.name: rotate_neg90
methods.docstring: rotate_neg90 rotates this vector counter-clockwise by 90.

methods.name: rotate_radians
methods.docstring: rotate_radians rotates this vector clockwise by `rad` in radians.

methods.name: round
methods.docstring: round rounds the components of this vector to the next-higher integer.

methods.name: round_to_fixed
methods.docstring:
round_to_fixed rounds the components of this vector to the provided
 number of digits.

methods.name: round_to_multiple
methods.docstring:
round_to_multiple rounds the components of this vector to the closes
 multiple of `v`.

methods.name: set
methods.docstring: set sets the x and y components of this Vec2.
methods.signature: fn Vec2::set(self : Vec2, x : Double, y : Double) -> Vec2

methods.name: sub
methods.docstring: sub subtracts the vector `v` from this vector.

methods.name: sub_scalar
methods.docstring: sub_scalar subtracts scalar `s` from this vector.

methods.name: transform
methods.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
methods.signature: fn Vec2::transform(self : Vec2, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Vec2

methods.name: op_equal
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: output
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: to_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

methods.name: from_json
methods.docstring: automatically derived

values.name: affine_transform
values.docstring: affine_transform transforms this Anchor by the provided `affine_matrix`.

values.name: affine_transform_without_translation
values.docstring:
affine_transform_without_translation transforms this Anchor's rotation, scale,
 and skew, without affecting its translation.

values.name: all_anchors
values.docstring: all_anchors returns all anchors.

values.name: almost_equals
values.docstring: almost_equals returns true if the vectors are equal within the provided tolerance.
values.signature: fn almost_equals(self : Vec2, other : Vec2, tolerance~ : Double = ..) -> Bool

values.name: area
values.docstring:
area represents the signed area of the bounding box (width*height).
 If min > max, the area will be negative.

values.name: as_fill
values.docstring: as_fill is a convenience function for setting a fill color.

values.name: assign_style
values.docstring: assign_style assigns a stroke and fill style to this CompoundPath.

values.name: bbox
values.docstring: bbox is a convenience function.
values.signature: fn bbox(minx : Double, miny : Double, maxx : Double, maxy : Double) -> BoundingBox

values.name: boolean_intersect
values.docstring:
boolean_intersect returns a new BoundingBox representing the intersection
 of this bounding box with one or more boxes if one exists.

values.name: bounding_box
values.docstring: bounding_box returns a BoundingBox for this Anchor.

values.name: canonicalize
values.docstring: canonicalize ensures that min < max.

values.name: center
values.docstring: center returns the center point of the bounding box (the average of min and max).

values.name: clone
values.docstring: clone returns a copy of this 2D affine matrix.

values.name: closest_point
values.docstring:
closest_point returns the closest point to `point` or None if no point is found.
 area_of_interest is used to focus the computation within a smaller region.
values.signature: fn closest_point(self : Anchor, point : Vec2, area_of_interest? : BoundingBox) -> Vec2?

values.name: contains_bounding_box
values.docstring: contains_bounding_box returns true if `box` is contained within this bounding box.

values.name: contains_point
values.docstring: contains_point returns true if `point` is contained within this bounding box.

values.name: copy
values.docstring: copy copies another 2D affine matrix into itself and returns itself.

values.name: determinant
values.docstring: determinant returns the determinant of the 2D affine matrix.

values.name: expand_scalar
values.docstring: expand_scalar expands this bounding box by a scalar distance on all sides.

values.name: expand_to_include_bounding_box
values.docstring: expand_to_include_bounding_box expands this bounding box to also cover `box`.

values.name: expand_to_include_point
values.docstring: expand_to_include_point expands this bounding box to include `point`.

values.name: fill
values.docstring: fill is a helper function.

values.name: group
values.docstring: group is a convenience function.

values.name: has_tangent_handles
values.docstring:
has_tangent_handles returns true if this Anchor has handles that
 are tangent to each other.

values.name: has_zero_handles
values.docstring: has_zero_handles returns true if this Anchor has handles that are both zero.

values.name: height
values.docstring: height returns the height of the bounding box.

values.name: invert
values.docstring: invert inverts this 2D affine matrix.

values.name: is_contained_by_bounding_box
values.docstring: is_contained_by_bounding_box returns true if this Anchor lies within `box`.

values.name: is_identity
values.docstring: is_identity returns true if this 2D affine matrix is the identity matrix.

values.name: is_inf
values.docstring: is_inf returns true if any elements of this 2D affine matrix are infinite.

values.name: is_intersected_by_bounding_box
values.docstring:
is_intersected_by_bounding_box returns true if the Anchor lies on the
 boundary of `box`.

values.name: is_invertible
values.docstring: is_invertible returns true if this 2D affine matrix is invertible.

values.name: is_mirror
values.docstring: is_mirror returns true if this 2D affine matrix mirrors either axis.

values.name: is_nan
values.docstring: is_nan returns true if any elements of this 2D affine matrix are NaN (not a number).

values.name: is_orthogonal
values.docstring:
is_orthogonal returns true if the two basis vectors of the 2D affine matrix
 are orthogonal within the provided tolerance.

values.name: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box
values.docstring: is_overlapped_by_bounding_box returns true if the Anchor is within `box`.

values.name: is_uniform_scale
values.docstring:
is_uniform_scale returns true if both basis vectors of this 2D affine matrix
 are of the same length.

values.name: loose_bounding_box
values.docstring:
loose_bounding_box is a simple computation that returns a BoundingBox which
 may not be the smallest possible.

values.name: luminance
values.docstring: luminance returns the relative luminance of this color for standard human vision.

values.name: mix
values.docstring: mix linearly interpolates between this Color and `c` with mixing factor `t`.
values.signature: fn mix(self : Color, c : Color, t : Double) -> Color

values.name: mul
values.docstring: mul multiplies this 2D affine matrix with another.

values.name: mul_without_translation
values.docstring:
mul_without_translation multiplies this 2D affine matrix with another,
 discarding the transation.

values.name: normalize
values.docstring:
normalize scales the basis vectors of this 2D affine matrix
 so that they have unit length.

values.name: op_mul
values.docstring: op_mul multiplies two 2D affine matrices together, returning a new one.

values.name: origin
values.docstring:
origin translates the matrix such that the center of future
 scale, rotate, and skew transformations will be `v`.

values.name: overlaps_bounding_box
values.docstring: overlaps_bounding_box returns true if any part of `box` overlaps this bounding box.

values.name: pre_mul
values.docstring:
pre_mul multiplies another matrix `m` by this 2D affine matrix, then
 stores and returns the result.

values.name: pre_mul_without_translation
values.docstring:
pre_mul_without_translation multiplies another matrix `m` by this 2D affine matrix,
 discarding the translate, then stores and returns the result.

values.name: reverse
values.docstring: reverse reverses this Anchor.

values.name: rgba
values.docstring: rgba is a convenience function.
values.signature: fn rgba(r : Double, g : Double, b : Double, a : Double) -> Color

values.name: rotate
values.docstring: rotate rotates this 2D affine matrix by `angle` degrees.

values.name: scale
values.docstring: scale scales this 2D affine matrix by `v`.

values.name: scale_scalar
values.docstring: scale_scalar scales this 2D affine matrix uniformly by `s`.

values.name: set
values.docstring: set sets the RGBA components of this Color.
values.signature: fn set(self : Color, r : Double, g : Double, b : Double, a : Double) -> Color

values.name: size
values.docstring: size returns a vector representing the (width,height) of the bounding box.

values.name: skew
values.docstring: skew skews the Y basis vector of this 2D affine matrix by `angle` degrees.

values.name: stroke
values.docstring: stroke is a helper function.

values.name: text
values.docstring:
text generates a new Graphic (a Group of Group of compound_paths) from a text
 string and a font.
values.signature: fn text(text~ : String, font~ : @gmlewis/fonts.Font, align~ : TextAlign = .., size~ : Double = ..) -> Graphic!DrawError

values.name: to_css_hex_string
values.docstring: to_css_hex_string returns a CSS-style hex string for this color.

values.name: to_css_rgba_string
values.docstring: to_css_rgba_string returns a CSS-style "rgba()" string for this color.

values.name: to_css_string
values.docstring: to_css_string returns a CSS-style string for this color.

values.name: to_hsva
values.docstring:
to_hsva converts this color to the HSVA color space, returning
 [hue, saturation, value, alpha] in the range (0..1).

values.name: to_rgb8_number
values.docstring: to_rgb8_number returns a bit-packed number in RGB8 format.

values.name: to_transform
values.docstring: to_transform converts this 2D affine matrix to a Transform.

values.name: transform
values.docstring: transform provides a convenient API for a common task.
values.signature: fn transform(self : Anchor, position~ : Vec2 = .., rotation~ : Double = .., scale~ : Vec2 = .., skew~ : Double = .., origin~ : Vec2 = ..) -> Anchor

values.name: translate
values.docstring: translate translates this 2D affine matrix by position `v`.

values.name: unit_circle
values.docstring: unit_circle constructs a new Group representing a unit circle centered at the origin.

values.name: unit_square
values.docstring: unit_square constructs a new Group representing a unit square centered at the origin.

values.name: vec2
values.docstring: vec2 returns a new Vec2.
values.signature: fn vec2(x : Double, y : Double) -> Vec2

values.name: width
values.docstring: width returns the width of the bounding box.
